meanings.definition: Train excessively beyond what is necessary or beneficial.
meanings.sent1: Some athletes overtrain by exercising too much and not giving their bodies enough time to rest.
meanings.sent2: It is important not to overtrain in order to prevent injuries and burnout.
meanings.sent3: The coach warned the team not to overtrain, or they might end up too tired to play in the championship game.
meanings.sent4: She realized she had been overtraining when she could barely lift her arms due to muscle fatigue.
meanings.sent5: Overtraining can lead to decreased performance and overall fitness levels.

meanings.definition: To work out too much or too intensely, leading to physical or mental exhaustion.
meanings.sent1: After a long day at work, she decided to overtrain at the gym, pushing herself beyond her limits.
meanings.sent2: It's important to listen to your body and not overtrain, as it can have negative effects on your health.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly told his friend not to overtrain at the gym unless they wanted to be sore for a week.
meanings.sent4: Overtraining can be compared to trying to run a marathon without any prior training.
meanings.sent5: She learned the hard way that overtraining can lead to burnout and decreased motivation.
